results.title: Sept Visions Fugitives
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Sept Visions Fugitives was produced in China. Cahen creates impressionistic transformations of landscape and people. He writes: “The looking and listening audiences are confronted — in addition to the pure impressions — with basic questions about work (the boy using a traditional device to shake the feathers from the mattress) about freedom, about life in China … and ultimately about life and death: the burial, the bird, the man with a sheaf of straw on his back symbolizing the passage, the beyond ….. I had to struggle to make what I know are stereotyped images my own. The pure impressions and raw filmic material are completely reworked, going much further than the original takes.” Source: Electronic Arts Intermix [www.eai.org]

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 4
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

This video covers the leadup to the first public look of Florence at PAX Australia 2017 of the first public look of Florence. In it, Mountains reflects on about its reception by the public and the game’s upcoming release.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 3
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

These interviews focus on how Mountains developed the musical score and tone of the game, working with game composer Kevin Penkin. This video features behind the scenes footage of the soundtrack’s recording session.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 2
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

These interviews cover the overall creation process for Florence, focusing on how the developer creates a cohesive story through discussions, storyboarding, the art style, the music and the characters.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 1
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

In this series of interviews, the developers at Mountains speaks about the studio’s foundation and introduces the staff, describing itself as a ‘craft game studio’. Florence is introduced as a result of this craft, as the studio seeks to create an aesthetically beautiful and moving piece of art, and not simply a game.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Ninolakis the Poet]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows an intimate lounge room party and poetry reading by a poet known as Ninolakis.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.
results.description:

results.title: Living with forests
results.creator_credit: Ian Toohill, Stephen Skok and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Living with forests: The future of Leadbeater’s forest is the subject of a local enquiry. The viewer is asked to imagine that you are a member of the local community and give your views.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Toohill, Stephen Skok and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch

results.title: Mots' Mansion [videogame trailer]
results.brief_description: Special Mention in the Middle Videogame category. Sam, Bec and their Mother move in to Grandma’s house. But when Bec is captured, Sam needs to complete tasks given to him by the mysterious MOTS. Can he trust the Man on the Stairs and will they both make it out. In the end, the choices you make will matter.

results.title: The Mysterious Mister E
results.creator_credit: Tom Barham and Mansfield State High School
results.brief_description: Winner in the Senior Animation category. Mister E is an enigmatic vigilante courier delivering packages that need to be hidden from an oppressive government, who monitor everything. But what will happen when the government catches on to Mister E’s mischievous movements? And what tricks does Mister E have up his sleeve to evade them?

results.title: My Brother's Bedroom
results.brief_description: A winner in the Junior Animation category for Screen It 2016. My brother’s bedroom door was always closed. I was never allowed into his bedroom. What was the mystery? I couldn’t stand it any longer and had to risk everything to have a look at what was behind his bedroom door.
